name: The Invisible String: 1 Paperback ‚Äì Picture Book, 11 December 2018
reviews: This is a beautiful book if you're looking for a book to discuss death to a child. I purchase this for my son when his Poppy died and it helped him understand whats happening in a way a child can intepret/understand. That was covered on two pages, its not just what the book is about. It would also be a great book for kids who suffer from separation anxiety as it covers quite a few scenarios. This can help a child feel connected which is so important. I highly recommend this book. And the author has more books like this one too.

reviews: I bought this for my 3yo after she started daycare and was really hating being away from me.  The invisible string is a beautiful idea and helped her to feel more secure. reviews: This book helped my little Mr. get through Kindergarten transition. He was quite unsettled and had a fair bit of separation anxiety when he started Kinder. We read this lovely book , a few times over. It helped him understand that no matter how far you might be, you‚Äôre always connected by an invisible string of love. We still refer to this book, 1 year later.  An absolute gem.

name: The Invisible String: 1 Paperback ‚Äì Picture Book, 11 December 2018
reviews: Would be nice if it rhymed, but it doesn't. Still, it's a beautiful story of twins (and I have twins, so I replace their names with the characters' names when I read it to them) who are afraid to go to bed at night,  but mama says they're connected with an invisible string. This will help kids with separation anxiety. About to give them their own room, so this story would definitely help. This story could help a child deal with grief from a lost of a loved one as well as it mentioned a connection to a relative in Heaven.

name: The Invisible String: 1 Paperback ‚Äì Picture Book, 11 December 2018
reviews: As a teacher, I am always on the lookout for resources that can support my students through challenging times, and "The Invisible String" is an absolute gem. This beautifully written children's book offers a gentle yet profound way to help kids cope with grief and loss. The story's simple yet powerful message about the invisible connections we share with our loved ones resonates deeply with children, providing comfort and reassurance during difficult times.What I love most about "The Invisible String" is its ability to spark meaningful conversations in the classroom about emotions, empathy, and the importance of relationships. The illustrations are captivating, and the narrative is filled with warmth and compassion. I have witnessed firsthand how this book has touched the hearts of my students and helped them navigate through their emotions with grace and understanding. If you're looking for a heartfelt and impactful book to support children dealing with loss, "The Invisible String" is a must-have addition to your collection.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2024

reviews: H√©las, il n'existe qu'en anglais.Mais si la langue de Shakespeare ne vous fait pas peur, allez-y, foncez. Non, d'abord lisez un peu ce qui suit, on ne sait jamais.L'histoire: par une nuit d'orage, les jumeaux fraternels Jeremy et Liza se r√©veillent et vont retrouver leur maman au salon car ils ont peur et ne veulent pas retourner se coucher seuls. Leur maman leur explique alors le secret de la Invisible string. Cette ficelle magique, bien que non visible, relie tous les coeurs qui s'aiment, les enfants √† l'√©cole qui se languissent de maman par exemple. Mais elle existe aussi pour les gens aim√©s partis h√©las avant nous, elle ne se rompt pas meme si maman gronde, meme si l'on se dispute entre fr√®re et soeur, voil√† toutes les th√©matiques abord√©es page apr√®s page. Les enfants retournent se coucher avec la pens√©e de toutes ces Invisible strings qui relient le coeur de tous. Un excellent livre pour le coucher et pour les petits anxieux.

name: The Invisible String: 1 Paperback ‚Äì Picture Book, 11 December 2018
reviews: If you're going to have any book in your kid's library, I highly recommend The Invisible String. It explains in gentle and simple terms that we are all connected by an invisible string of love, whether we are separated by long-distance, only a few hours and even with pets and people who have passed on. If you have a child who struggles with separation anxiety at school or at daycare, this book is the perfect way to help them understand that even though you're separated for a few hours, you're still connected by love. It's also a good way to teach kids about death in a gentle way, that even though animals and people are no longer with us on Earth, they are still connected to them by this invisible string. I especially love how at the end (SPOILER ALERT) it explains how everyone in the world in connected as one. <3

name: The Invisible String: 1 Paperback ‚Äì Picture Book, 11 December 2018
reviews: My daughter loves this book. She is 4 and has been trying to make sense of death. It‚Äôs a clever way to explain to children love will always be there even if you are not together.

Highly recommended for any kid struggling with attachment or even just starting school or staying out for the first time etc.
